sentences.en: A hedgehog rolls itself into a ball when attacked.
sentences.cn: 刺猬一受到攻击就蜷缩成一团.

sentences.en: A hedgehog will contract its body into a ball when frightened.
sentences.cn: 刺猬受惊时会将身子缩成一团.

sentences.en: Even though it might look like a porcupine, the hedgehog eats insects and small animals while the porcupine is a vegetarian.
sentences.cn: 尽管它看上去可能象一只豪猪，然而刺猬是个素食动物，它只吃昆虫和小动物。

sentences.en: Hedgehog starts pulling off his quills one by one enduring sharp pain.
sentences.cn: 刺猬忍着巨痛,开始一根一根的拔掉自己身上的刺.

sentences.en: Hedgehog walks out of hiding, in fact he's also quite sad.
sentences.cn: 刺猬走出来, 其实他心中也很难过.

sentences.en: If you touch a hedgehog it will react by curling into a ball.
sentences.cn: 如果你触摸刺猾,它会以卷缩成球的形式作出反应.

sentences.en: It looks like a hedgehog with a lot of pricks.
sentences.cn: 它看起来像一只长满刺的刺猬.

sentences.en: Oh goodness, then it must have a hedgehog.
sentences.cn: 哎呀, 那肯定是个刺猬.

sentences.en: One of the sharp hollow spines of a porcupine or hedgehog.
sentences.cn: 豪猪或刺猬身上硬而中空的保护刺.

sentences.en: So she went in search of her hedgehog.
sentences.cn: 因此她就走了，找她的刺猬去了。

sentences.en: The hedgehog curled up as I came near.
sentences.cn: 当我走近时,刺猬就卷起身子.

sentences.en: The hedgehog only comes out at night to scurry around for a meal.
sentences.cn: 刺猬只在夜间出来，到处匆匆地转，找寻食物。
刺猬把身子蜷缩成一团.

sentences.en: We found a little hedgehog in the field.
sentences.cn: 我们在田里发现了一只小刺猬.

sentences.en: You can't call a hedgehog cuddly – that's a contradiction in terms!
sentences.cn: 你不能说刺猬逗人喜爱——那个说法,词语自相矛盾.

sentences.en: You look like a hedgehog. Why don't you use some hair gel?
sentences.cn: 你看起来像只刺猬, 干吗不用点发胶?

trans.tran_cn: 刺猬，〈美〉豪猪，容易发怒的人，难对付的人，[军]刺猬弹，[植]野毛茛
trans.tran_en: a small brown European animal whose body is round and covered with sharp needle-like  spines
